decks.notes: The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while simultaneously applying pressure with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Gurmag Angler. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Brazen Borrower, and utilize card selection cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces to win the game quickly and efficiently. It looks to be a fast-paced aggressive deck with a focus on disruption and tempo.

This deck focuses on using a combination of efficient counterspells, removal, and disruptive spells to control the game while deploying aggressive threats like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Hooting Mandrills. By maintaining a balance between disruption and aggression, the deck aims to apply pressure on opponents while disrupting their game plan, ultimately securing a swift victory by overwhelming the opponent with a consistent stream of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Ninja tribe to aggressively attack the opponent while also disrupting their strategy with hand disruption and removal spells. By combining the evasive abilities of Ninjas like Fallen Shinobi and Yuriko with cards like Baleful Strix and Plague Engineer, the deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent. With a mix of control elements like Force of Will and removal spells, the deck can quickly deploy threats and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine, using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier. Once the graveyard is filled, the deck can easily bring back creatures from the graveyard, especially Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, using cards like Carrion Feeder and Altar of Dementia. Bridge from Below also synergizes well with this strategy, allowing for additional creature tokens to be created. This creates a fast-paced combo deck that aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures.

The main focus of this Legacy Aggro deck is tempo control and disruption through a combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, along with powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to apply pressure early with aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is optimized for consistency with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands, allowing for easy access to all three colors of mana necessary for the deck's spells.

This Canadian Threshold Legacy deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis to apply early pressure on the opponent. The deck includes disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to protect its threats and control the game. The mana base consists of a combination of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana production and also includes Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The inclusion of powerful planeswalker Wrenn and Six provides additional value and card advantage to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards such as Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp. This allows for easy reanimation of creatures like Ichorid and Narcomoeba to overwhelm the opponent. With the use of Lion's Eye Diamond and Bridge from Below, the deck can create an overwhelming board presence and win the game through a powerful combo. The deck also includes disruption elements like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to utilize graveyard synergies to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through the use of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Snapcaster Mage. By utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic to fetch powerful equipment and Narset, Parter of Veils to limit opponent's card draw, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building its own board presence. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce help protect key plays, while versatile cards like Council's Judgment offer additional removal options. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victory through smart plays and strategic card choices.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize various fast mana rituals and cantrips to quickly assemble the pieces needed to cast a powerful storm spell like Tendrils of Agony, generating a massive amount of storm count and dealing lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to ensure the combo can go off without interference. Past in Flames can be used to recast spells from the graveyard, while Ad Nauseam can provide additional card advantage and help dig for combo pieces.

This deck relies on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine, allowing you to bring them back easily. The main goal is to get Hogaak onto the battlefield as soon as possible, using cards like Altar of Dementia to fuel its cost. Cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Careful Study help dump cards into the graveyard, while Bridge from Below provides additional value when creatures are sacrificed. Cabal Therapy is used for disruption, making it difficult for your opponent to stop your combo from going off.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough. Once the graveyard is full, the player can utilize cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy to generate token creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a large number of creatures on the battlefield and potentially win the game in a single turn through explosive plays with Lion's Eye Diamond and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis.

The key strategy of this deck is to quickly and aggressively control the battlefield using a combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and True-Name Nemesis, and powerful disruption spells such as Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce. The deck aims to pressure opponents with early threats while disrupting their game plan with countermagic and removal spells. The mana base is built around a balance of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors and maintain tempo by utilizing Wasteland to disrupt opposing mana bases.

This Legacy Dredge deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp to trigger powerful graveyard recursion effects. By milling through the deck and bringing back creatures like Narcomoeba and Ichorid, the deck can swarm the board with threats and overwhelm the opponent. With cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Therapy, the deck also has ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own game plan. The key strategy is to quickly fill the graveyard and use graveyard interactions to establish a dominant board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly drop powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield by using cards like Show and Tell or Sneak Attack. By utilizing fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, along with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze for protection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its combo pieces before they can establish a defense. The deck focuses on speed and consistency in order to win the game in just a few turns.

The deck focuses on using Elves to generate mana quickly and efficiently, allowing for explosive plays such as casting early game-winning threats like Craterhoof Behemoth or Archon of Valor's Reach. Cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote help draw through the deck while Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel generate massive amounts of mana. The deck also includes ways to tutor for key pieces like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith. The key strategy is to overwhelm opponents with a large board state and powerful creatures in a short amount of time.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, with support from cards like Chalice of the Void and Cavern of Souls to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes mana acceleration options like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb to help ramp into bigger threats early on. By utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and applying early pressure with efficient creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm and outpace the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.
